info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:11PM EDT until July 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN SHENANDOAH...FREDERICK...NORTHERN WARREN AND CLARKE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA...NORTHEASTERN HARDY AND SOUTHEASTERN HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES IN EASTERN WEST VIRGINIA AND THE CITY OF WINCHESTER... At 409 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stephens City, or 7 miles southwest of Winchester, moving east at 55 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHERN VIRGINIA ESPECIALLY INCLUDING THE CITY OF WINCHESTER AND Stephens CITY. HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Many mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Many homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. Locations impacted include... Winchester, Strasburg, Millwood Pike, Berryville, Stephens City, Star Tannery, Middletown, Boyce, High View, White Post, Gaylord, Blue Mountain, Nineveh, Albin, Bethel, Clary, Capon Springs, Stringtown, Gravel Springs and Howellsville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION with tornado like wind speeds expected. Mobile homes and high profile vehicles are especially susceptible to winds of this magnitude and may be overturned. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm has the potential to cause serious injury and significant property damage. This storm is producing destructive winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
